display_information.name: TimeShift
display_information.long_description:
TIMESHIFT: INSTANT TIMEZONE CONVERSION IN SLACK

Overview:  
TimeShift converts time references in Slack messages to your local timezone with a simple right-click, making global team coordination effortless.

How to Use TimeShift:
1. Find a message containing a time reference (e.g., "Meeting at 1400 CET" or "Call at 3:30 PM SST")
2. Right-click on the message to open the context menu
3. Select "Convert to Local Time" from the shortcuts menu
4. View the converted time in the modal that appears

Supported Time Formats:
- 24-hour format with timezone: 1400 CET, 14:00 CET
- 12-hour format with timezone: 2:30 PM EST, 2PM PST
- Times embedded in messages: "Let's meet at 3:00 PM SST tomorrow"

Supported Timezones include North American (EST, CST, PST), European (GMT, CET), and Asian/Oceanian (IST, SGT, SST, HKT) abbreviations.

User-Friendly Features:
- Automatically detects your Slack profile's timezone
- Extracts time references from anywhere in messages
- Handles various time formats with or without colons
- Supports global timezone abbreviations

Simply right-click, convert, and never miss a meeting due to timezone confusion again!

shortcuts.name: Convert to Local Time
shortcuts.description: Convert a time mentioned in a message to your local timezone
